generalDisclosure.title: General Disclosure
generalDisclosure.content: The materials and content provided by TradersYard GmbH, whether on our website, through distributed documents, or other communications, are intended solely for general informational purposes. This content does not constitute investment advice, an offer to buy or sell securities, or an endorsement of any financial instruments, companies, or funds. Users should not interpret the information as personalized financial advice. The information provided is not targeted at any specific jurisdiction and should not be used in any manner that would contravene local laws or regulations. TradersYard GmbH, registered at Kärntnerring 5-7, 1010 Vienna, Austria, adheres to all relevant European and international legal standards. © 2026. All rights reserved.

riskDisclosure.title: Risk Disclosure
riskDisclosure.content: Engaging in futures, forex, and other financial trading involves significant risk and is not appropriate for all investors. It is possible to lose the entire amount of your investment, or even more. Only use risk capital-money you can afford to lose without impacting your financial security or lifestyle. Trading should only be undertaken by individuals who have the necessary capital, can understand the risks involved, and acknowledge that past trading results do not guarantee future performance. TradersYard GmbH does not warrant the accuracy or completeness of the information provided and is not responsible for any losses or damages resulting from reliance on this information.

hypotheticalPerformance.title: Hypothetical Performance Disclosure
hypotheticalPerformance.content: Performance results based on hypothetical data have many inherent limitations and should not be relied upon as indicative of actual future performance. Hypothetical performance figures are often generated with the benefit of hindsight and do not involve financial risk, thus differing significantly from actual trading results. Many factors, including market conditions and the capacity to endure losses, can adversely affect actual trading outcomes. Testimonials and other promotional materials on our website do not necessarily represent the experiences of other clients and do not predict future performance.

customerCompensation.title: Customer Compensation Disclosure
customerCompensation.content: All trade examples presented for compensation purposes are hypothetical and should not be expected to reflect live trading results. It is important to note that hypothetical and simulated trades do not fully represent the financial risks associated with actual trading. Traders are advised that any account will achieve profits or losses similar to those shown.

cftcCompliance.title: CFTC Rule 4.41 Compliance Overview
cftcCompliance.content: In accordance with CFTC Rule 4.41, hypothetical or simulated performance results have a critical limitation: they are imperative to address the use of hypothetical or simulated performance results in any advertising materials. Such results, being inherently limited, do not stem from actual trading activities and, therefore, may misrepresent the impact of real market conditions, such as liquidity. These models, often constructed with the benefit of hindsight, lack predictive value regarding future trading outcomes. It must be acknowledged that no assurance is provided that any trading account will achieve profits or losses similar to those illustrated and that risk disclosure language is seen as a vital aspect to inform potential clients of these limitations and the inherent risks involved. Furthermore, it is essential to note that testimonials included within such advertisements are not indicative of all clients' experiences and do not serve as a guarantee of future performance or success. Past performance metrics should not be interpreted as reliable indicators of future results. Compliance with these stipulations is not only a regulatory requirement but a critical measure to ensure transparency and protect potential investors from misleading representations. All advertisements must incorporate this specific disclosure language to remain compliant with CFTC Rule 4.41

questions.q1: What makes TradersYard different from other prop firms?
questions.a1: We focus on transparency and speed. No hidden rules, lightning-fast payouts under 4 hours, and the most sought after feature - no trailing drawdown.
questions.q2: What are the rules around drawdown and consistency?
questions.a2: Daily drawdown is 5% of your starting balance, max drawdown is 10%. No minimum trading days. We don't have arbitrary consistency rules - just trade profitably and manage your risk.
questions.a3: No monthly fees. Ever. You pay a one-time evaluation fee, and that's it. For forex and futures. No subscriptions, no hidden costs. Keep your profit split percentage without any ongoing charges.
questions.a4: We process payouts in 1-2 business days after KYC approval. During public holidays no payouts are processed. Most traders receive their profit-share payments within 4-6 business-hours of requesting a payout.

fundedAccount.title: Funded Account
fundedAccount.description: Get your funded account and start earning real profits while keeping up to 95%.

rules.title: Rules
rules.heading: Rules

profitTarget.title: Profit Target
profitTarget.content:
## 2 Phase Accounts:

### Phase 1: 10%

To pass Phase 1, you must achieve a **10% profit** based on your initial starting balance.

For example, if your challenge account starts at **$100,000**, you must grow it to **$110,000** with all trades closed to meet the target.

### Phase 2: 5%

In Phase 2, the profit target is **5%** of your initial starting balance. For example, if your challenge account starts at $100,000, you must grow it to $105,000 with all trades closed to meet the target.

### Funded Account: No Target

Once you pass both phases, you receive a funded account.
**There are no fixed profit targets on funded accounts.**

## 1 Phase Accounts:

For 1 Phase accounts, profit target is **10%** for phase 1 and **no target** for funded account.

## Futures (1-Phase) Accounts:

Static Drawdown Futures accounts have 8% profit target.

EoD drawdown Futures accounts have 6% profit target.

dailyMaxLossLimit.title: Daily and Max Loss Limit
dailyMaxLossLimit.content:
## 2 Phase Accounts:

### Daily Loss Limit: 5%

You are allowed a maximum daily loss of **5%** based on your starting equity of the day at UTC 00:00.

For example, your 100k account will have daily loss limit of $5,000. If your day starts with equity of $107,000, then your equity must not drop below $102,000 at any point during that day.

### Maximum Loss Limit: 10%

The max loss limit is static **10%** of your starting balance.
This means your account must not fall below $90,000 at any time during the 100k challenge.

Breaching daily or maximum loss limit will fail your account at any phase or funded account.

⚠️ **Failed & Reset Policy**

If your account breaches the daily or maximum loss limit, it is immediately failed.

Failed accounts cannot continue trading and must be reset to phase 1.

Example, if you fail at funded account in 2 Phase challenge, after reset your account will be reset to Phase 1.

## 1 Phase Accounts:

For 1 Phase accounts, daily loss limit is **3%** and maximum loss limit is **6%**

## Futures (1-Phase) Accounts:

No Daily Drawdown on any Futures accounts.

Static plans have Max Drawdown of 4%. This is truly static and never trails.

EoD Drawdown Futures accounts have drawdown amount as follows: for 50K Account - $2,000, for 100K Account - $3,000 and for 150K Account - $4,500.

leverageOffered.title: Leverage Offered
leverageOffered.content:
We provide different leverage depending on the account type. Higher leverage gives traders more flexibility, while lower leverage is designed for those who prefer longer-term, swing-style trading with reduced risk exposure.

**2 Phase Swing Accounts:** Forex: 1:30, Commodities: 1:10, Indices: 1:15, Crypto: 1:1, Stocks: 1:1

**1 Phase Accounts:** Forex: 1:30, Commodities: 1:10, Indices: 1:15, Crypto: 1:1, Stocks: 1:1

rules._comment_leverageOffered_2PhaseStandard: TEMPORARILY HIDDEN - UNCOMMENT WHEN NEEDED: **2 Phase Standard Accounts:** Forex: 1:100, Commodities: 1:30, Indices: 1:50, Crypto: 1:2, Stocks: 1:2

timeLimitsPayoutCycle.title: Time Limits and Payout Cycle
timeLimitsPayoutCycle.content:
There are no time limits in any phase of the challenge or in the funded account to pass. Traders can progress entirely at their own pace without the pressure of deadlines.

Once a funded account is started, the first payout can be requested after 14 days. If a trader is in a loss but has not breached the account, there is still no restriction or cycle forcing them to reset - they can take as much time as needed to return to profitability and request a payout. The payout cycle only resets when a trader actually requests a payout, which means the timing remains fully in the trader's control.

For example, a trader who begins a funded account on Day 0 becomes eligible to request a payout on Day 14. If they continue trading without requesting a payout, there will not be any need of new cycle. Even by Day 45, nothing changes until they choose to request payout. If the trader decides to request a payout on Day 50, only then does the payout cycle reset once payout amount is transferred, and the next 14-day window begins from that point.

For Futures accounts, minimum payout is 1% of the initial balance.

payoutsScalingPlans.title: Payouts and Scaling Plans
payoutsScalingPlans.content:
## Payouts

Traders can request a payout once their profits reach $50 or more, at the end of each payout cycle.

In order to withdraw payouts from Futures accounts, minimum payout amount is 1% of the initial balance.

First payout for Futures plans are on demand.

## Scaling Plans

You will be eligible for scaling your current funded account, only if:

- You have requested payouts in total of more than 10% of the account balance within the last 90 days
- These payouts must have been made from the same funded account, either through a single payout request or multiple combined requests spread across these 90 days
- Account must not have failed during this 90 days period
- The 90-day period is counted from the date you received your first funded account at that level
- If you cannot achieve 10% in total payouts within 90 days, then scaling will be rejected and new 90 days period will be started on that funded account
- Account will be reviewed for scaling during the payout withdrawal process

You can see a complete scaling plan [here](/account-scaling)

No Scaling plan available for Futures accounts

⸻

### **Example - Trader starts with $50,000 account:**

**Step 1 - Start of Review Period**

The trader places their first trade on January 10th.

This begins their 90-day review window (Jan 10 → Apr 10).

⸻

**Step 2 - Trader Reaches 10% Profit**

Within those 90 days, the trader earns $5,000, which is 10% of the starting balance, and they request a payout.

Because they hit the requirement within the review period, they qualify for scaling.

⸻

**Step 3 - Account Scales Up by 20%**

The account increases by 20% of the original starting balance:

- Original Balance: $50,000
- Scaling Increase (20%): $10,000
- New Balance: $60,000

⸻

**Step 4 - New 90-Day Review Window**

A brand-new 90-day review period begins on the day scaling is applied.

Example:

If scaling is applied on April 10, the new review window is:

April 10 → July 10

To scale again, the trader must earn 10% of the new balance ($60,000) within this next 90-day period.

⸻

**If the Trader Doesn't Reach 10%**

If the trader does not meet the requirement within the 90-day window, they will simply be reviewed again in the next 90-day cycle.

newsTrading.title: News Trading
newsTrading.content:
News trading is allowed on 2-Phase CFD and 1-Phase Futures accounts but is not permitted on 1-Phase CFD accounts.

Trading is restricted during high-impact news events. Specifically, traders are not allowed to open or close trades within 2 minutes before or after a high-impact news release. During this period, any pending orders, including stop losses and take profits of the existing positions, cannot be executed by system.

We strongly recommend closing open positions before such news events to avoid unexpected volatility and losses.

overnightWeekendHolding.title: Overnight and Weekend Holding
overnightWeekendHolding.content:
**Overnight Holding:**

Allowed on all account types except Futures accounts. Traders may keep positions open beyond market close each day in CFD accounts. On Futures accounts, trades will be automatically closed at the market close of each day.

**Weekend Holding:**

Allowed only on 2-Step Swing Accounts. For all other account types, positions will be automatically closed on Friday (including crypto). 

New positions can be opened on Crypto on weekend. 

**Swap Charges:**

All positions held overnight are subject to swap charges.

prohibitedPractices.title: Prohibited Practices
prohibitedPractices.content:
To keep trading fair and professional, certain practices are not allowed. If these rules are broken, your account may be investigated, restricted, or suspended.

### Order Limits & Frequency

You cannot place more than 500 active orders at once. High-frequency trading is also prohibited - the system will block more than 300 requests per minute (placing, modifying, or canceling orders).

### Market Exploits

Trading strategies that rely on system glitches, delayed feeds, or arbitrage are forbidden. Any attempt to manipulate prices or exploit the platform will result in account closure.

### Risk Management Discipline

Profit targets cannot be achieved with a single oversized trade. Traders are expected to trade consistently with proper lot sizing and stop losses, instead of reckless risk-taking.

### Multiple Accounts

Hedging across accounts is not allowed. Opening opposite positions in different accounts, even if owned by the same person or group, will lead to disqualification.

### Gambling Behavior

Martingale, grid strategies, random lot sizes, or reckless scalping are considered gambling and are strictly prohibited.

### Trading Style

Avoid overconcentration on a single asset, heavily one-sided bets without analysis, or impulsive overtrading. A disciplined and researched approach is required.

No HFT, no exploits, no gambling strategies, no multi-account hedging - always trade with consistency and discipline.

inactivityPolicy.title: Inactivity Policy
inactivityPolicy.content:
All accounts must remain active to keep trading privileges. If an account shows no trading activity for 30 consecutive days, it will be marked as inactive. Inactive accounts are automatically deleted after 30 days of inactivity. Once deleted, the account cannot be recovered, and the trader must purchase a new challenge to continue.

We recommend placing at least one trade within each 30-day period to ensure your account stays active.

NOTE - In the event that you will be traveling and cannot place a trade, please message our support team and we will make arrangements for you to preserve your account.

payoutCap.title: Payout Cap
payoutCap.content:
For all CFD accounts, there is no payout cap. Traders can request a reward of any size.

For all Futures accounts, first 5 payouts are capped as follows:

- on 10K Static Drawdown account: $500
- on 25K Static Drawdown account: $1,000
- on 50K Static Drawdown account: $2,000
- on 50K EoD Drawdown account: $3,000
- on 100K EoD Drawdown account: $4,000
- on 150K EoD Drawdown account: $5,000

If trader reaches the payout cap on funded account, all trades will be automatically closed and trading will be paused until trader receives the payout.

swapsCommission.title: Swaps and Commission
swapsCommission.content:
**Commissions:**

Forex, Indices, Crypto, Commodities:
$1.5 per lot, charged per execution
e.g., 0.5 lot = $0.75

Stocks & ETF CFDs:
0.025% of trade value
e.g., 100 shares at $100 = $2.50

**Swaps (Overnight Fees):**

Long trades: -0.008% per lot
Short trades: +0.002% per lot
Applied daily on open positions

about.title: About
about.heading: About Us
about.description: The Yard is where traders prove themselves. We’re a global prop firm built in Austria. Backed by Swiss capital, trusted worldwide. Clear rules, daily payouts.

timeline.heading: Our Journey
timeline.description: From an Austrian social network idea to a global trading platform trusted by thousands of traders worldwide.

story.intro: TradersYard didn't start perfect. We began in Austria as a social network for traders. It looked good on paper, but we learned fast-traders don't need another feed, they need real opportunity. So we pivoted from feed and follows to an arena built around challenges, transparent rules, and fast predictable payouts.
story.present: Today, our in-house platform and Discord community make it easy to practice, pass, and trade with confidence-still born from that original idea of traders helping traders, now with capital behind it.
story.future: Looking ahead, our goal is clear: build the most trusted path for traders to grow worldwide. We're focused on the disciplined, the ambitious, and the ones serious about making trading their craft. What sets us apart is simple: fair rules, daily payouts, zero gimmicks, and the consistency traders can actually count on.
story.cta: So-think you have what it takes to become the next TradersYard funded trader? There's only one way to find out. Take advantage of our current promo while it lasts, lock in your spot, and start proving your edge. We'll see you inside the Yard.

timeline.2015: Manuel & Gilbert building up AgenaTrader, a multi-broker Trading-Platform for advanced Traders
timeline.2022: Social-Network for trading launched and used by 20k+ traders
timeline.2023: Private-Equity investment from Andromeda Capital Partner Suisse and Pivot to Prop-Trading Focus
timeline.2024: Building the complete Prop-Trading Infrastructure and Tech-Stack in-house, launching the new prop-trading product
timeline.2025: Adding classic 2-step and 1-step plans to the product portfolio, expanding to US with futures-based challenges
